info.title: Country
info.description:
The Country resource represents the tax rates applied to orders from the different countries where a shop sells its products.

{{ '/api/reference/country.png' | image }}

Merchants select the countries where they sell their products when they set up their shipping zones and rates on the Shipping page of the Shopify admin. After adding a country to a shipping zone, store owners can then verify and adjust tax rates for each country on the Taxes page.

The Country resource lets you access the countries and tax rates set up by the merchant. The countries list includes a default entry called Rest of World, which represents all non-specified countries.

You can use the Country resource to modify the sales tax rate for a country or sub-region to account for surtaxes or exemptions that apply to the store.

For more information on managing tax rates for sub-regions of a country, such as states or provinces, see the Province resource.

Caution

As of version 2020-10, you can no longer create or update custom tax values for the Country resource.

paths.summary: Receive a list of all Countries

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

200.description: Receive a list of all Countries

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Country.all(
  session: test_session,
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve all countries after the specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries.json?since_id=359115488" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Country.all(
  session: test_session,
  since_id: "359115488",
)

paths.description:
Caution

As of version 2020-10, the tax field is deprecated.

Creates a country.

x-examples.name: Create a country using Shopify's tax rate for it

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"country":{"code":"FR"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

country = ShopifyAPI::Country.new(session: test_session)
country.code = "FR"
country.save!

x-examples.name: Create a country using a custom tax rate

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"country":{"code":"FR","tax":0.2}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

country = ShopifyAPI::Country.new(session: test_session)
country.code = "FR"
country.tax = 0.2
country.save!

curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries/count.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Country.count(
  session: test_session,
)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

x-examples.name: Retrieve a specific country by its ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries/879921427.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Country.find(
  session: test_session,
  id: 879921427,
)

paths.description:
Caution

As of version 2020-10, the tax field is deprecated.

Updates an existing country.

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"country":{"id":879921427,"tax":0.05}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries/879921427.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

country = ShopifyAPI::Country.new(session: test_session)
country.id = 879921427
country.tax = 0.05
country.save!

curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/countries/879921427.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Country.delete(
  session: test_session,
  id: 879921427,
)

properties.description: The two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format).
properties.name: code

properties.description: The ID for the country. The ID for a country is unique across all Shopify stores. The ID for a country in one shop will be different from the same country in another shop.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The full name of the country in English.
properties.name: name

properties.description:
The sub-regions of a country, such as its provinces or states. Each sub-region has the following properties:

  • code: The two letter province or state code.
  • country_id: The ID for the country to which this sub-region belongs.
  • id: The ID for the particular sub-region.
  • name: The name of the sub-region.
  • tax: The tax value in decimal format.
  • tax_name: The name of the tax as it is referred to in the applicable sub-region. For example, in Canada, the sales tax in the province Ontario is referred to as HST.
  • tax_type: The tax type. Valid values: null, normal, or harmonized. If the value is harmonized, then the tax is compounded of the provincial and federal sales taxes.
  • tax_percentage: The tax value in percent format.
properties.name: provinces

properties.description: The national sales tax rate applied to orders made by customers from that country.
properties.name: tax

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Manage the country and provincial tax rates that are applied to applicable items at checkout.
